Chapter on Hells, Part 5
Again, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and contemplate the great hell of wailing. What other places are there?
They see, hear, and know:
There is another place called 'Enduring Firm Suffering Unbearably,' which is the third separate place in that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
They see, hear, and know:

If one kills, steals, engages in sexual misconduct, drinks alcohol, delights in doing so, and does it often, one will fall into that hell and be born in the place of enduring firm suffering unbearably. The karma and its fruits are as explained above.
There is also lying.
What is lying?
If a king or his officials seize someone, whether due to others, one's own circumstances, or receiving bribes to escape danger, or if others testify, or if one lies for a living in this way.

Due to the causes and conditions of this evil karma, when that person's body perishes and their life ends, they fall into a bad place, into that hell, and are born in the place of unbearable intense suffering, experiencing great suffering.
The so-called suffering is as follows:

Due to evil karma, snakes are born on their own bodies, crawling everywhere throughout their bodies, pulling out their tendons everywhere. Due to the causes and conditions of hell, they devour their body parts, eating their spleen and intestines, rolling around inside. Such suffering is more intense than the suffering of fire.
In this way, they experience the great suffering of snakes there, the suffering of evil poison, more severe than fire, and such suffering has no end.
The suffering experienced in that hell is intense and unbearable, and cannot be fully described.

The suffering in that hell is unbearable, yet one does not die. At all times one experiences extremely intense suffering, until finally the evil karma is destroyed and rotten, and the force of the karma is exhausted. At all times one is given suffering without cease;
If the evil karma is exhausted, they will then escape that hell.
If in past lives, a long time ago, there was any good karma that matured, they will not be born in the realms of hungry ghosts or animals;
if born among humans in a place with the same karma, as soon as the mother becomes pregnant, she will always be sick.

Due to the power of evil karma, from the beginning in the womb until birth, the mother's illness will not improve. If the child is born, it will immediately become ill, and all physicians will be unable to cure it.
This is the remaining karmic retribution for the original evil karma.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and contemplate the great hell of wailing sounds. What other places are there?
They see, hear, and know:
There is another place called Squeezed According to One's Wishes, which is the fourth separate place in that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
The karma that is created and accumulated causes birth in that place. They see:
If someone kills, steals, engages in sexual misconduct, drinks alcohol, and enjoys lying and doing it often, they will fall into that hell and be crushed according to their wishes.
The karmic retribution for killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, and drinking alcohol is as explained above.
What is meant by lying?
It refers to:
Someone claiming another's land, seizing another's land, arguing with lies, speaking crookedly, not speaking straightforwardly;
Seizing another's land, using words to suppress others, and taking the law into their own hands.

Due to the causes and conditions of that evil karma, when that person's body perishes and their life ends, they fall into a bad place, into that hell where one is crushed according to one's wishes, and experiences the suffering of being crushed.
The suffering referred to is as explained above, the suffering experienced in the hells such as Saá¹ƒjÄ«va. All that suffering is experienced there in full.
The hell beings in the hells such as Saá¹ƒjÄ«va, upon seeing this hell, all point and say:
That is a hell!
What is called suffering:

There are two iron bellows filled with wind. The Yama demons place the sinners in an iron furnace, also like placing iron, and blow with the bellows to the utmost. The iron tongs hold them on an iron anvil and the iron hammer strikes them. After striking like this, they are placed back in the furnace and blown with the two iron bellows as before.

Because of their evil karma, the heat is extremely intense. After blowing, they are blown again. After blowing, they are taken out with tongs and placed on an iron anvil. With a hot iron hammer, they are struck to the utmost, struck continuously, struck many times, and struck urgently. After striking like this, they are still alive and not dead.
Again, they are taken with tongs and placed in a cauldron of boiling water, held upright and made firm, like this at all times without a moment's rest.
Until their evil karma is destroyed, rotten, and without breath, they will then escape from that hell.
If in past lives, in the distant past, there is good karma that matures, they will not be born in the realms of hungry ghosts or animals;
If reborn among humans in a place with the same karma, they will always be thirsty, have much anger, and be distrusted by others. This is the remaining karmic retribution of that evil karma.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and contemplate the great hell of wailing. What other places are there?
They see, hear, and know:
There is another place called Complete Darkness, which is the fifth separate place in that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
They see:
If one kills, steals, engages in sexual misconduct, drinks alcohol, and speaks falsely, enjoying it and doing much of it, one will fall into that hell's place of Complete Darkness.
The karma of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, and drinking alcohol, as well as their fruits and retributions, are as explained above.
What is meant by false speech?
It is as follows:
If someone commits adultery with another's wife, and then speaks falsely in front of a crowd of people or in front of the king, saying:
I have not actually committed this woman.
causing the woman's family to incur misfortune.

Because of the causes and conditions of this evil karma, when that person's body perishes and their life ends, they will fall into a bad place, into that hell's place of complete darkness, and experience immense suffering and pain.
The suffering is as follows:
Their head splits open and the tongue comes out. After it comes out, it is cut with a knife. After it is cut, it grows back again, and is painfully cut again with a flaming knife.
In this way, for innumerable hundreds of thousands of years, until the evil karma is destroyed, rotten, and its energy exhausted, suffering is continuously inflicted at all times;
only when the evil karma is exhausted will they escape that hell.
If in past lives, a long time ago, there was any good karma that matured, they will not be born as a hungry ghost or an animal;
if born among humans in a place with the same karma, they will be born blind, deaf, and dumb, always at the head of the road or at a crossroads, begging for a living.
In this way, one obtains such a person as one's parents, begging for a living in countless homes, with a short lifespan, without wife or children.
This is the remaining karmic retribution of those evil actions.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the karmic retributions and observe the great wailing hell, and what other places are there?
They see, hear, and know:
There is another place called Human Darkness Smoke, which is the sixth separate place in that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
They see, hear, and know:
If one kills, steals, engages in sexual misconduct, drinks alcohol, and tells lies, enjoying doing them and doing many of them, one will fall into the Human Darkness Smoke place in that hell.
The karmas of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, and drinking alcohol, as well as their fruits and retributions, are as explained above.
What is meant by lying?
It is as follows:
There are people who make a living together with others, making a pact with incense and fire, doing business in different places. If they actually obtain wealth, they falsely say:
'I did not obtain anything.'
And they do not share it.
Such a person is a great thief who robs others of their wealth.

Due to the causes and conditions of that evil karma, when their body perishes and their life ends, they fall into a bad place, into that hell called Human Darkness and Smoke, and experience immense suffering.
The suffering is as previously explained, the suffering experienced in the hells such as Saá¹ƒjÄ«va. They experience all that suffering there.
And there is more:
In this place, all their body parts are completely cut open;
after being cut open, they grow back, soft and tender, and are cut again;
after being cut, they grow back again, softer and more tender, and are cut again. This is the gross retribution for their evil karma and suffering. All the flesh is gone, leaving only bones;
Insects will emerge from their own bodies, with diamond-sharp beaks, burning with flames of various colors, devouring their bodies;
they will experience various kinds of suffering, crying out in loud voices.
Those hell beings will be like this for countless hundreds of thousands of years, until their evil and accumulated karma is destroyed, dissipated, and exhausted, only then will they escape that hell.
If in their past lives, a long time ago, there was any good karma that matured, they will not be born as hungry ghosts or animals;

if born among humans in a place of the same karma, all their body parts will be rotten and smelly, with wet insects on their heads, always lacking clothing, poor and suffering, even if they have a little, it will all be patched together, and no one will believe their words, they will be unloved by people and ignorant of livelihood. This is the remaining karmic result of their evil karma.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and contemplate: What other places are there in the great Saá¹ƒghÄta hell?
They see, hear, and know:
There is another place called Like Falling Insects, which is the seventh separate place in that hell.
What karma do sentient beings have that causes them to be born in that place?
He saw:

There are people who kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, drink alcohol, and tell lies, who enjoy doing these things and do them often, and fall into that hell and are born in the separate place of Like Falling Insects.
The karma of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, and drinking alcohol, as well as their fruits and retributions, are as explained above.
What is meant by telling lies?
It is as follows:
There are people who take the possessions of the saá¹ƒgha, whether grain or clothing, and sell them everywhere, buying cheap and selling dear;
Having obtained the profit, they do not give it to the saá¹ƒgha, saying they did not make a profit, and deceive the saá¹ƒgha.
Such people, with a greedy mind, tell lies and say:
'I only got this, there is nothing else.'
'The business I managed only yielded so much.'
Such people engage in business while lying.
Such foolish people act out of greed.

Due to the causes and conditions of such evil karma, when their bodies perish and their lives end, they fall into a bad place, into that hell, and are born in a separate place called 'Falling Like a Flying Insect.' They experience great suffering.
The suffering is as follows:

There are iron dogs that bite open their bellies, and once opened, eat themâ€”eating their intestines and back. The henchmen of Yama seize axes, the axes blazing with flames, and chop up their flesh to weigh it on a scale, one ounce or half an ounce, to feed to the dogs.
The axes are extremely sharp, and they also chop up their bones to obtain the marrow, to give to the dogs.

Hot flaming iron hooks hook under their jaws, and once they are broken open, hot flaming iron pincers pull out their tongues, and they are driven to stand up. Hot flaming iron hooks hook their bodies, and the flesh is all torn apart. In this way, they pull out their sinews, and all parts of their bodies are completely hooked.
In this way, the person who engages in the evil karma of lying creates evil karma for themselves and eats accordingly.

When the person who lies has escaped the messengers of Yama, there is a great blazing fire filling the hell, with no empty space in between. The sinner who lies enters the fire hell like a flying insect, always burning like this. After burning, they are reborn, and after being reborn, they are burned again.
In this way, for countless hundreds of thousands of years, until the created and accumulated evil karma is destroyed, without any remaining, they will then escape that hell.
If in past lives, in the distant past, there was good karma that matured, they will not be born as a hungry ghost or an animal;

If born among humans in a place with the same karma, they will be born in a poor and lowly family. As soon as they are born, they will be burned. Even if there are many people with strict defenses, they will still be burned. This is the remaining karmic retribution of that evil karma.
The bhiká¹£u also knows the results of karma and observes the great hell of wailing. What other places are there?
He sees, hears and knows:
There is another place called 'Death and Life', which is the eighth separate place in that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
He sees, hears and knows:

If a person kills, steals, engages in sexual misconduct, drinks alcohol, and also tells lies, enjoying doing them and doing many of them, they will fall into the hell of 'Death and Life' in that place.
As explained before, the suffering experienced in the hells of 'Alive' and so forth is complete in this place, and there is also another kind of suffering, namely:
Beaten with a stick, one dies, but when the stick is removed, one comes back to life.
In this way, for countless hundreds of thousands of years, one dies and comes back to life, comes back to life and dies again. This is because of one's evil karma.
If they manage to escape, they will next see a forest of blue lotus flowers and run towards it, hoping for rescue and refuge. But they will see the blue lotus flowers filled with blue flames.
What is the result of this false speech?
Namely:
There are people who are not renunciants but who, for the sake of theft, put on the robes of renunciants. They see many people who want to travel through the wilderness and ask them:
'Are there thieves in that wilderness?'
Knowing there are thieves, they reply:
'No,ğŸ”½ğŸ”½
Those people, having arrived, are robbed by thieves and lose their possessions.
Because of falsely speaking and deceiving others, due to the power of faith in their karma, they receive results that correspond to their karma.
They see the blue lotus flowers filled with blue flames,
and the henchmen of Yama seize them and support them in the blue lotus flowers, burning them with fire, because they have no feet and cannot get out.
The power of similar evil karma causes the hands, feet, eyes, and everything of those sinners to disappear.
In this way, the great fire fills the lotus flowers in this hell, and they are burned and boiled for countless hundreds of thousands of years, dying and reviving again.
Until their evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and the energy of karma is exhausted, they will always be given suffering without cease;
only when their evil karma is exhausted will they escape from that hell.
If in past lives, a long time ago, there was good karma that matured, they will not be born in the realms of hungry ghosts or animals;
if born among humans in a place with the same karma, their speech will not accord with reason, but will be self-centered and deceitful;
even if they obtain wealth, it will be seized by the king, and they will die in prison.
This is the remaining karmic retribution of that evil karma.
Moreover, that bhiká¹£u, knowing the consequences of karma, observes: What other places are there in the great Saá¹ƒghÄta hell?
He sees, hears and knows:
There is another place called Different Transformations, which is the ninth separate place of that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
He sees:

There are people who kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, drink alcohol, and tell lies, who enjoy doing these things and do them often, and fall into that hell's place of Different Transformations.
The karma of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, and drinking alcohol, as well as their fruits and retributions, are as explained above.
What is meant by lying?
It is as follows:
There are people who deceptively tell lies in order to cause others to win or lose, to suffer or benefit, to live or die.
It is as follows:

There are people who are astrologers and are good at divination, whose divinations are always accurate. If there are virtuous people who always speak the truth, they are trusted by the world. There may be other reasons why others ask questions. They think like this:
'I do not tell lies. Everyone knows this. Everyone trusts me.'
I now speak falsely, and people all think it is true.
Having thought like this, he then speaks falsely.
Because of false speech, he can cause the entire country to be lost, or if a superior person dies, he can cause enemies to rob and lose each other's wealth.
That person who speaks falsely is trusted by all, and they believe his false words.
That person who speaks falsely has the appearance of right conduct, but is actually a thief.
Because of this unwholesome karma, when that person's body perishes and life ends, he falls into a bad place, into that hell called 'Different Transformations,' and experiences great suffering.
The suffering is as follows:

In that hell, one sees one's parents, servants, acquaintances, and good friends who previously saw one in the human realm, comforting one in the hell. Having heard the affectionate words, one runs quickly towards them, hoping for rescue and protection.
The person runs to another place, enters the ash and fire, like a stone falling into water, sinking and then rising again, experiencing great suffering and screaming loudly.

Again seeing parents, wife, children, incense, good friends and acquaintances, he runs again. Due to evil karma, an iron hook appears on the road, hooking his body. When he arrives, he is again seized by the Yama's men. An iron saw burns and cuts his body, just like cutting wood.

In this way, if the sinner escapes that place, only bones remain, and all his limbs are broken. He runs to another place, and is again seized by other Yama's men and placed in a burning iron knife wheel.
The iron knife wheel has knives above and below.

Due to evil karma, such an iron wheel with sharp knives is filled everywhere. The wheel spins rapidly, burning with flames, grinding the person who committed the evil karma of lying into dust like flour. After being ground, he is born again.

When the hell beings escape from the wheel, they see their parents, wives, children, incense-offering good friends, and acquaintances, hoping for rescue and refuge, and run towards them. Due to their evil karma, as they run like this, many hot flaming iron hooks appear on the road. There is an evil lion born from evil karma that seizes the sinners in its mouth, between its teeth. The Yama demons hook them out with hot flaming iron hooks. After they are hooked out, they think and run again.

As they run like this, their feet are torn apart, and the blazing fire burns extremely, destroying all their limbs. They are burned and scalded, yet they still do not stop running. Their entire body is covered in wounds, and all the bones and blood vessels in their bodies are exhausted.
This is the similar karmic result of the pleasure and abundance of lying.
As that person said:
I am a truthful person.
They speak false words, deceitful words, and slanderous words. In this way, they see their parents, spouse, children, incense-offering good friends, and so forth.

The person who speaks false words thus experiences boundless suffering, enduring suffering that is firm and sharp. In this way, for countless hundreds of thousands of years, they are constantly boiled, constantly burned, constantly split, and constantly beaten, until their evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and their karmic energy is depleted. At all times, they are given suffering without cease;
only when their evil karma is exhausted will they escape from that hell.
If in past lives, a long time ago, they had good karma that matured, they will not be born as a hungry ghost or an animal;

if born among humans in a place with the same karma, they will be poor and lowly, with incomplete faculties and always sick, hated by all, distrusted by all, defiled by all, and their efforts will be in vain. What they seek they do not obtain. This is the remaining karmic retribution of that evil karma.
The bhiká¹£us know the results of karma and observe the great hell of wailing. What other places are there?
They see, hear, and know:
There is another place called Futile Hope, which is the tenth separate place in that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
They see, hear, and know:

If people kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, drink alcohol, and also tell lies, enjoying doing them and doing many of them, they fall into the place of futile hope in that hell. The karma and its results are as explained above.
Now I will explain lying.
What is lying?

For those in distress, whether sick people, hungry people, thirsty people, poor people, orphans, low-class people, or foolish people, if they have no rice or any other food, no food or drink, no clothes, bedding, or dwellings, whether they beg or not, if one promises but does not give, they always hope, and later give up hope.

Due to the causes and conditions of this evil karma, when that person's body perishes and their life ends, they fall into a bad realm, into that hell of false hopes, and experience immense suffering.ğŸ”½Because they promised food but later did not give it, due to that evil karma, they see in that hell various delicious foods such as ká¹›sara and pÅ«pas, and places adorned with all kinds of wonderful things. That hell being, extremely hungry and thirsty, quickly runs towards those foods. From afar they see those foods, extremely delicious and attractive, clean and complete. But when they arrive, they disappear, and all they see is burning iron juice, blazing with intense flames.

Having gone towards those foods, they quickly run, but due to their evil karma, the path is filled with iron hooks that grab and tear at their bodies. They finally arrive at that place, as explained before, and in due course reach that place. The foods they see are all molten iron, blazing with intense flames, with a foul color and smell. This is the result of their false speech and evil karma.
Having approached and seen it, one immediately falls into it. If one smells its scent, one's nose is burned and falls off.
If one touches it with the body, all parts of the body are burned and emit flames like fireflies. The iron liquid burns the lips.
Having burned the lips, it next burns the throat;ğŸ”½having burned the throat, it next burns the heart;
having burned the heart, it next burns the spleen;
having burned the spleen, it next burns the intestines.
In this way, having burned the raw intestines, it next burns the cooked intestines;
having burned the cooked intestines, it exits from below.

Moreover, having agreed to give bedding and sleeping materials as offerings, if one later does not give them, due to that false speech karma, one is tormented by cold and heat and suffers greatly, with nothing to hope for.
In that hell, on a ground of hot copper plates, the sinful person sits and all parts of the body melt away. Having melted and burned, they are reborn again.

If a person promises to give shelter to a guest in their house but then does not provide it, due to the karma of that false speech, they will be placed in the cauldrons of joy and compliance. The size of those cauldrons is fifty yojanas, filled with boiling molten iron.

The head of that evil karmic person will be facing downward when they enter. Once they enter the cauldron, they will either float up or sink down, all of them boiling and cooking. If not yet cooked, they will sink; if cooked, they will float.
Having floated up, they will sink down again.
In this way, boiling and cooking, all the flesh on their body will be stripped off, with sinews, skin, and bones scattered, and all the joints will be greatly damaged and reduced.
That cauldron is very dark, filled with boiling iron, burning their body, causing them to cry out and wail.
After being cooked there, they will enter another cauldron, where they will be cooked again. When cooked, they will float up, just as in the first cauldron, so it is here as well.

Thus, they go up and down, sometimes coming out and sometimes entering. Those sinners are sometimes combined into one place, sometimes scattered. When they are close to each other, they touch each other with extreme heat, and thus they touch each other a hundred thousand times, with their bodies breaking into a hundred thousand pieces and then growing again.

Again, they touch each other with extreme heat, and thus they touch each other a hundred thousand times, with their bodies breaking into a hundred thousand pieces. Bound by the noose of evil karma from their original false speech, they experience such suffering at all times.
Thus, until the evil and unwholesome karma of those who speak falsely is destroyed and rotten, and the energy of the karma is exhausted, they will always experience suffering without cease;
only when the evil karma is exhausted will they escape from that hell.
If in past lives, in the distant past, there is wholesome karma that has matured, they will not be born in the realms of hungry ghosts or animals;

If reborn among humans in a place of similar karma, they will be born as slaves, belonging to the people they deceived in their previous lives, because in their previous lives they promised but did not give.
Or they may belong to other people as slaves, due to different karma.
Why is this?

Because from beginningless time, life after life, they have been revolving, creating various evil and unwholesome karmas. Thus, they are bound by the noose of karma, which is difficult to encounter, and are therefore reborn in different places, unable to meet each other.

For this reason, they may sometimes become slaves of other people, always lacking food, drink, bedding, shelter, and medicine according to their illnesses, and are always scolded and humiliated by their masters. This is the remaining karmic retribution of their evil karma.
Moreover, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and observe: What other places are there in the great Saá¹ƒghÄta hell?
He sees, hears, and knows:
There is another place called Double Affliction, which is the eleventh place of that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
He sees:

If one kills, steals, engages in sexual misconduct, drinks alcohol, delights in doing so, and does much of it, one falls into that hell's place of Double Affliction. The karma and its effects are as explained above.
Moreover, there is false speech.
What is false speech?
It refers to:

In the midst of a village, in a community gathering, if one speaks falsely out of a mind of arrogance, out of an angry mind, out of mutual hatred and jealousy, or out of mutual conflict, deceiving oneself and others, destroying oneself and others, causing others to be punished in that assembly due to such false speech, and feeling joyful in one's mind.
If one creates such karma repeatedly, creates it and accumulates it,

Due to the causes and conditions of this evil karma, when that person's body perishes and their life ends, they fall into a bad place, into that hell where there is double torment, and experience great suffering.

In this way, due to false speech and evil talk in social gatherings, by such causes and conditions, when that person's body perishes and their life ends, they fall into that hell and are born in a separate place of double torment, experiencing great suffering.
The suffering is as follows:
It is like the hells of Reviving, Black Rope, Crushing, and Screaming described above, but even worse.
Due to evil karma, there is a flaming-toothed lion there.
That evil lion seizes the hell beings who told lies, as described above, and torments them in various ways.
After they are freed, the lion lifts them up to eat them. When lifted up, they die; when put down, they come back to life.
Moreover, it eats all their body parts. After eating, they are born again; after being born, it eats them again.

Due to evil karma, the lion's teeth in the machine are filled with blazing flames. With such teeth, they devour the offenders. By the power of evil karma, they are bitten and burned in the lion's mouth, suffering two kinds of pain.

Thus, for innumerable hundreds of thousands of years, they are constantly burned and crushed, suffering greatly, until their evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and its energy is depleted. At all times, they are given no respite from suffering;
only when their evil karma is exhausted will they escape that hell.
If in past lives, a long time ago, there was any good karma that matured, they will not be born as hungry ghosts or animals;

if born among humans in a place of the same karma, due to the power of evil karma, they will either be bitten by a snake and die, or be killed by a lion, tiger, or bear and eaten. This is the remaining karmic retribution of their evil karma.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the consequences of karma and contemplate: What other places are there in the great Saá¹ƒghÄta hell?
He sees, hears, and knows:
There is another place called Mutually Squeezing, which is the twelfth place of that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
He sees:
There are people who kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, drink alcohol, and tell lies, who enjoy doing these things and do them often, and fall into that hell's place of Mutually Squeezing.
The karma of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, and drinking alcohol, as well as their fruits and retributions, are as explained above.
What is meant by lying?
There are brothers, some close and some distant, who are in dispute.
Those brothers may have the same father, the same ancestor, or be unrelated brothers, or uncles and nephews, who are fighting over the division of property.

If there are those of the same clan lineage, even up to twenty-one generations, such people come to bear witness. Among such people, one speaks false words to benefit those who are close, knowing oneself that it is not true, but deliberately teaching them to accept flattery, and skillfully calculating to speak false words.

When that karma becomes pervasive and complete, that person, due to the causes and conditions of that evil karma, when body perishes and life ends, falls into a bad place, into that hell where one is crushed by others, and experiences immense suffering.
The suffering referred to is as previously explained, the suffering experienced in the hells such as Saá¹ƒjÄ«va. All that suffering is experienced there in full.

Moreover, there is something worse. Due to that person's false speech and deception of relatives, evil karma causes there to be iron scissors and knives in the hell realm. Seeing the relatives who were deceived in the human realm, the [hell guardians] cut their flesh and put it in their mouths, driving them to eat it. Due to evil karma, their own flesh does not digest.
The Yama people spoke a verse to reproach him, saying:
Truth leads to peace and happiness, truth leads to nirvana,
False speech produces bitter fruits, now come here to receive them.
If one does not abandon false speech, then one will obtain all suffering,
Truth does not need to be bought, it is easily obtained and not difficult.
Truth does not come from a foreign country, nor does it come from a different person,
Why do you abandon truth and delight in speaking false words?
Truth is the best savior of the mouth, by truth one obtains all dharmas,
Truth is the best among lamps, thus have the Tathagatas taught.
Truth is the best among medicines, it is always able to destroy suffering,
Doing evil is not my teaching, you yourself foolishly create it.
You yourself create evil karma, now you yourself receive it,
When karma is exhausted you will be liberated, why do you cry out in understanding?
Now you wail in vain,
Deceiving yourself is foolish, Wailing is not wise.
